div.p: This site provides information using PDF, visit this link to download the Adobe Acrobat Reader DC software.

div.div:
Parents/Guardians,
Please watch this video from Mr. Bigger for an update on continuing education.
Please participate in the LASD Online/In-Home Learning Survey to give us feedback.
If you haven't watched the video from staff, here is a link to the LASD COVIDStrong Thunder Video
Have extra time and want to chat? Join a Zoom for Brunch Time with Bigger
When: Every Tuesday and Thursday from 10:00 to 10:45 am
Where:Zoom Meeting (just click on this link at 10:00 am
Why: To engage with members of the community, parents, and staff informally to discuss current and future events.
Enjoy your weekend and stay safe! Mr. Bigger
div.p:
All LASD schools are physically closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will maintain learning online/at home and follow the school calendar through June 5th, 2020. Please know we will do everything we can to hold end of year events in some form such as graduations and awards ceremonies provided we can keep everyone safe. Be patient as we formulate ideas and plans over the coming weeks and monitor state health guidelines for gatherings and events. Each building will communicate in early May the process and procedure moving forward.
We wish you a wonderful Holiday (Easter) with family. Please disconnect from the computer, phone, and tablet throughout the break. Yes that is right! We do not want you to do any school work for 4 straight days. We all need a "reset" away from devices.
We miss seeing you all. Stay Safe, Stay Healthy, Stay Home!
Mr. Bigger

hr.p:
Dear Families,
Please enjoy the Doodly link which highlights the first week back to "school" and the weeks ahead. After watching, please see the updated Q and A to assist in your short and long range planning. Thanks to everyone for working together as a community to overcome the hurdles in front of us. We plan to provide as much compassion, structure, and consistency over the coming weeks as possible for you and your family.
Each building will be sending direct communication home about their respective schools as decisions are finalized, such as senior course completion, Kindergarten registration and middle school transitions. We understand this is a lot of information and will continue to provide communication through a variety of outlets so you are exposed to the same information multiple times.
In support of our local business I am providing a link to the paycheck protection program application for Small Businesses, Sole Proprietors, Independent Contractors, Non-Profits & Self-employed Individuals which opens today. For more details go to the Adams Alliance website.
All My Best,
Chris Bigger
Dear Thunderbolt families,

We are committed to supporting student learning during the statewide closure of schools. Beginning on Monday, March 30th, 2020 teachers will post learning opportunities for the week. Students are encouraged to participate in the learning opportunities posted. The activities will not take the place of the regular classroom instruction, but are meant to provide opportunities for students to engage in learning at home.

p.strong: Learning Opportunities for students in grades K-5 can be found on the Continuing Education website. More detailed information will be coming to you through a Sapphire communication, and Class DoJo.
Students in grades 6-12 will access learning through the Schoology platform. Students are reminded to check their district-issued email account as well.

hr.p: Maintaining routines is important during this time. For our students, this means engaging their minds. All LASD teachers will be providing continuing education opportunities as if we were physically present in school. In addition to core subjects, students will also have opportunities to continue their learning in the special and elective courses.

We have crafted guidelines for students and families to assist in the transition to this new way of doing “school”. We will all be on a learning adventure starting Monday and we will need everyone to be patient and positive.
Here is a link to the updated Q & A’s. Stay safe, stay at home, and stay connected. Thank you for your trust as we work together to support our students’ learning.
With Bolt Pride,
Chris Bigger, Superintendent of Schools
Lori Stollar, Director of Curriculum & Innovation
Dear LASD Families,

We have been informed by Governor Wolf that all PA schools will remain closed through at least April 9th, 2020, for students. Staff would be allowed to return, provided COVID-19 is subsiding, on April 7th and 8th with the first student day commencing on April 9th, 2020. Because this falls on a Holiday (Easter) weekend, LASD students would not physically return to school until April 14th, 2020.

LASD plans to provide continuity of education to students and families starting March 30, 2020 and progressing until we return to school physically. Continuity of education is designed to keep the minds of our youth actively engaged in a common curriculum. We want you all to participate fully in the continuation model because this will benefit everyone for the common good of our most precious resource, our children. Should we receive more direction from the Department of Education on the model of education allowed beyond April 6th, we will be sure to keep you informed.

We will maintain a stable, reliable, and steadfast guide to students and families throughout the mandatory shutdown period. We will do our very best to enrich the lives of our families daily as we would take care of our own. We only ask you to do the best you can as a family to support the same cause. We will find our way forward as a community. Stay informed by visiting the Update Center frequently.
All My Best,
Chris Bigger

Dear Parents, Students and Community,
Thank to everyone for being understanding and flexible during the COVID-19 outbreak of 2020. On Monday March 16th, 2020 we released a website to centralize our district communications. We have recently added information to the Update Center on the LASD Website with pertinent and timely information. The update captures everything we know as of March 20th, 2020. With Federal and State announcements happening frequently information and our actions continue to change.
Some highlights in the Updated Q and A include:

ul.li: We will continue to feed students.
We are preparing to offer continuing education starting March 30th, 2020.
We are requesting any student in need of a computer to fill out a form or call the school to request one.
We will be offering remote help desk for school devices.
PSSA's and Keystone Exams have been canceled for the 2019-2020 school year.

hr.p:
We hope you and your family are doing well and we will continue to do everything we can to assist people in need and continue everyone's education. We are planning to ensure the Seniors graduate on time. Stay tuned for more information as we finalize our path forward. Should you need anything please reach out to me on my cell phone at 717-729-7692.
Chris Bigger
PS You can review the staff communications being sent by Clicking Here.
Good Morning Littlestown Families:

Just a reminder to Littlestown Families, the school district continues to serve lunch for school aged children. A bagged lunch curbside pickup is available at Maple Avenue Middle School today, Thursday, and Friday from 11:00 AM to noon. Please stay in your car, we will deliver the food to the car. If you need the food delivered, as a last resort, please complete this form. Also, the student must be present in order for the lunch to be distributed.

Dear LASD Family,
We hope all of you are doing well and practicing all the recommendations of the CDC and the Department of Health while maintaining some normal routines. We have created a website to assist you in staying updated about our LASD family of students and staff. This website can be found by going to the main page of the website and clicking on the green Update Center at the top of the home page. If after you read all the information, particularly the FAQ's and you still have questions, please complete the form at the end of the FAQ document. We will gather common questions and add them to the FAQ document as we move forward.
The website consists of the following:
All communications sent directly from me.
Frequently Asked Questions and Answers - Read Me First
Staff Information Updates
PA Department of Health-COVID 19 Cases in PA
LASD Pandemic Checklist
Continuing Education
CDC and Other Resources
I want to thank the community for their patience and understanding as we navigate uncharted territory. When we receive guidance about the immediate future of education in Pennsylvania and Littlestown we will certainly share what we know. Should you need me for anything please call me on my personal cell phone at 717-729-7692.
All My Best,
Mr. Christopher E. Bigger
Dear Parent's Guardians,
Parents may pick up their childs' medication at school on Wednesday, March 18, 2020 between 3:00 - 6:00 PM. Please go directly to the nurse's office after 4:00 pm.
Thank You!

p.strong: Dear Littlestown Area School District Community

hr.p: Littlestown Area School District, along with health and government officials continue to monitor the latest developments regarding COVID-19, known as the Coronavirus. We are unaware of any student or staff member in our district having or being exposed to the virus; however, it is important for the district to maintain open communication with you regarding our ongoing measures to ensure the safety and security of our students, staff, and community.

To ensure the health, safety, and well-being of our students and staff, and to do our part in trying to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 throughout the District community and region, all Littlestown Area School District schools will be closed effective at 5:00 pm today Friday March 13th, 2020 through March 27, 2020.

The closure affects all programming at the school, including before-and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, weekend events, and all facility use by outside groups. We understand that this closure may cause an inconvenience, but trust that you will support our efforts on behalf of the wellness of our community.

In order to promote instructional equity for all of our students, the district will make up the days through the use of make-up days, adding days to the end of the year, and/or extended school hours. We will only use online learning as a last resort. These methods will be determined once we realize the full scope of impact that closures may have in the coming weeks.

All official District updates and information will be communicated via email, text message, website, social media, and phone calls in the days ahead. All public schools Adams, Franklin and York county are closing as well.
As always, protecting the health and safety of our students, faculty, and staff is our utmost concern, and we will continue to monitor the COVID-19 situation closely and communicate as appropriate.
Chris Bigger, Superintendent of Schools

All schools Superintendents in the state of Pennsylvania will be participating in a conference call at 9:00 am Friday March 13, 2020. After we receive guidance and direction we will communicate our next steps by the end of the day Friday. With the recent state closures of public schools in Ohio and Maryland the landscape is changing quickly. Thanks for being flexible, patient, and staying calm for the greater good. This is new territory for everyone and we will get through this as a community. We will do whatever it takes to provide the best education we can for our students in the safest environment.
Please continue to utilize the Department of Health website for the most accurate and up to date information.
Chris Bigger

hr.h3: Superintendent's letter addresses school virus monitoring:
hr.p: March 6, 2020
Dear Parents and Guardians:

The Pennsylvania Department of Health (DOH) and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) have issued updates on the Coronavirus. At this time, the DOH considers the virus a low risk to the majority of the public. People at higher risk would include those with weakened immunity, pregnancy, and those who are 60 and over. The Littlestown Area School District is monitoring, preparing for, and responding to the changing landscape of this new virus to keep our LASD family of students, staff, and parents safe. We will follow the recommendations from federal, state, and local health officials and provide you with updates as we receive them. Currently there are no reported cases connected to Littlestown Area School District.
Because we are at the height of cold and flu season, please remember the importance of the following:

ol.li: Fever - Your child must have a normal temperature for 24 hours before returning to school. Tylenol and Ibuprofen will mask the symptoms of fever, so this means a normal temperature without the use of medications.
Vomiting or Diarrhea - Your child should not have vomited or had diarrhea for 24 hours before returning to school.

hr.p: The CDC also recommends these simple everyday preventative actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory viruses.

ol.li: Stay home when you are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
Cover your mouth and nose with the inside of your elbow when you cough or sneeze.

hr.p: We are continuing to monitor information from the Department of Health and The Center for Disease Control that can be found on our school district website by clicking here. Moving forward, we will update our website and communicate with families, students, and staff through our communication systems in Sapphire, Social Media and Email.
Sincerely,
Christopher E. Bigger
Superintendent of Schools
